greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} binomial(n/d+d-2, d-1).
comment: Equals row sums of triangle A156348. - _Gary W. Adamson_ & _Mats Granvik_, Feb 21 2009
The binomial transform (note the offset) is 0, 1, 4, 11, 28, 67, 156, 359, 818, 1847, 4146, 9275, ... - _R. J. Mathar_, Mar 03 2013

a(n) is the number of distinct paths that connect the starting (1,1) point to the hyperbola with equation (x * y = n), when the choice for a move is constrained to belong to { (x := x + 1), (y := y + 1) }. - _Luc Rousseau_, Jun 27 2017
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms 1..1000 from Paul D. Hanna)
formula: G.f.: A(x) = Sum_{n>=1} x^n/(1 - x^n)^n. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Mar 01 2009
maple: A157019 := proc(n) add( binomial(n/d+d-2, d-1), d=numtheory[divisors](n) ) ; end:
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 21 2009
